scenes.location: NY APARTMENT BEDROOM DECEMBER DAY, 2031 CONTINUO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora waits for a shirt to come out of a 3D printer. It’s future, guys.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: Hey thanks for the bottle of water. It’s the little touches get you 5 stars. She shows him she rated him 5 stars on her version of Nit (which is like a Tinder/Uber hybrid.)

dialogues.speaker: BYRON
dialogues.text: Cool. Hey, you have time for a quick fuck before work?

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: I really don’t. Maybe if we get matched up again.

dialogues.speaker: BYRON
dialogues.text: Um, I haven’t rated you yet.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: ... Really, dude?

dialogues.speaker: BYRON
dialogues.text: I mean, two stars can significantly lower your average... Nora sighs and starts taking off her clothes.

dialogues.speaker: BYRON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Awesome. Thanks man.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: No, you know what? Fuck this. I‘1l take the two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad, bitch. I gave you a one.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: Wow. Okay then, I’1l earn it. She grabs the shirt and heaves the printer in the air, leaving as Byron scrambles to catch it. INT. HALL OUTSIDE BYRON’S APARTMENT - CONTINUOUS Pulling on her shirt, Nora hears a CRASH and smiles. Her phone dings and she sees a screen: “You have received a 0 star rating on your last Nitely experience. Would you lik to contest, y/n?” She scowls.

dialogues.speaker: FADE TO BLACK
dialogues.text: “Nathan”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The freeway is full of SELF-DRIVING CARS shaped like eggs INT. NATHAN’S SELF-DRIVING CAR - CONTINUOUS NATHAN BROWN, 27, things come easily to him, especially women, edits lines of computer code projected on windshield/screen. Nathan's best friend/work partner JAIME ARNAZ is on speak

dialogues.speaker: JAIME, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: There’s some kind of acceptance bias in the last three lines.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Yeah... what is that?... oh. He hits a few keys.

dialogues.speaker: JAIME, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (tired) Aw yiss. Nailed it. Okay, the AGIP protocol still needs work.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: God no. I gotta veg a little. See you later, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, we are so close-- Nathan hangs up, then pokes a key. His work is pushed to side. He decides to have some fun.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Car?

dialogues.speaker: CAR
dialogues.text: (Australian accent female) Yes, Nathan?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Clean camera lenses please.

dialogues.speaker: CAR
dialogues.text: Cleaning... Little squirts and wipers go off inside and out. While th car can’t see, Nathan shuts off the car’s brain and hacks something to drive using the keyboard with the W-A-S-D ke He swerves in and out, passing other cars and enjoying th startled looks. After a few seconds, he hears a SIREN.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Uh oh.

dialogues.speaker: FREEWAY SHOULDER
dialogues.text: Nathan explains out the window.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: It just started racing, who knows why. I’11 take it in to be serviced asap, swear to God. REVEAL he’s Facetiming a FEMALE CHP OFFICER on a tablet attached to a hovering DRONE.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m on my way to my parent’s house for Thanksgiving -- can you imagine if they were waiting and my car had -- I don’t even want to think about it.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE CHP OFFICER
dialogues.text: Uh huh. Car, what’s your story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don’t know what happened. Lost consciousness for a minute. Will update anti-virus software now.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, you do that. There’s a human life back here!

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE CHP OFFICER
dialogues.text: Okay, you can go. Get it fixed soon though. I don’t want to see you again.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Oh no...? He smiles at her. She laughs, charmed.

dialogues.speaker: CAR
dialogues.text: Should I call your long-time girlfriend Ingrid and tell her you will be late? The officer rolls her eyes and flies off.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: It’s called being nice. God. INT. NY SUBWAY - FUTURE DECEMBER DAY —- MORNING Ads for the big digital afterlives line the car. (“Experi ‘Ternity’ by Spectrum.” “Apple/Intel’s ‘Cove’” “40% off y first 100 years at Snap-Disney’s ‘Cumulus.’” “You did wel you deserve Lakeview by Amazon.”) Nora, squeezed on a bench, glances at the guy next to her He’s watching a telenovela called “Amor Despues de la Muerte.” A man holds his hand up to a giant screen. On th other side, a woman holds her hand up to touch his. Behin her is a color-saturated Puerto Rico beach resort.

dialogues.speaker: TELENOVELA WOMAN
dialogues.text: Me estas esperando?

dialogues.speaker: TELENOVELA MAN
dialogues.text: Dije que lo haria. Nora leans closer to the guy’s earbud to listen in. The g turns and kisses her on the mouth. She rubs her lip with sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Echh. Fucking commuters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora walks down the crowded sidewalk. Drones fly overhead like pigeons. The street is crammed with bikes, one of wh bangs into Nora.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: Ow! Fucking bikes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora hurries past protesters, holding signs like “Digital Afterlife is an Abomination to God!”

dialogues.speaker: PROTESTOR
dialogues.text: The Works of Man are Shit!

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: Fucking Ludds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Employees touch their index finger to a screen and are allowed to enter. Nora gives the middle finger to the scr then uses it to log in. She walks under a sign reading: “Amazon Lakeview Customer Service.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old Tesla Model S (a junker in the future) stops in fr and Jaime runs out. Behind him, the car parks itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jaime lets himself in and rushes to the dining room.

dialogues.speaker: JAIME
dialogues.text: Hey, Mrs. Brown, sorry I’m late-- whoa! He sees Nathan sitting next to INGRID KANNERMAN, 28, blon very beautiful but intense, surrounded by Nathan’s family

dialogues.speaker: JAIME, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ingrid. What are you -- I mean, am I crashing something? Ingrid nods. Nathan’s Mom, who is smoking a joint, waves his concern. NATHAN’S MOM Pshh, Jaime, you’re always welcome. Nathan, get him a chair.

dialogues.speaker: JAIME
dialogues.text: I'll help.

dialogues.speaker: JAIME
dialogues.text: The fuck?! She always has Thanksgiving with her family.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Invited herself. I didn’t think it was a great idea but she started crying, and I can’t handle crying.

dialogues.speaker: JAIME
dialogues.text: You could have told me she’d be here. I had time to kill myself.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Just drop it, man. She’s my girlfriend now and I love her. Get used to it.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Okay, but if she’s coming to family Thanksgiving, next thing she’s gonna expect is a proposal. Get used to that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrid holds up a spoon of rice with red berries.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: And it’s really called “barbarian stew?” NATHAN’S MOM No, those are “bar-berries.” The dish is Zereshk Pollo. It’s Persian, from my mother’s side.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Ha ahhaa. It is so good. Spicy!  Nathan and Jaime come back in.

dialogues.speaker: JAIME
dialogues.text: So, Ingrid, Nathan says you invited him to your grandma’s 100th birthday? NATHAN’S DAD A hundred! Wow, impressive.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Well, she’s in Heaven. NATHAN’S MOM Oh, which one?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Lakeview. NATHAN’S MOM Mmm, I’ve heard it’s beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Well, we’re an Amazon family. Prime on both sides. NATHAN’S DAD Heaven's too expensive for me. I'll be stored on a sim card until these two finish their free version.

dialogues.speaker: JAIME
dialogues.text: It won’t be long, if Nathan parties a little less and programs a little more. NATHAN’S MOM Pay him a salary, you can ask for a drug test.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Aw yiss, Mom!

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Well, you’d all be welcome at Lakeview. It’s surprisingly affordable. Awkward beat. Nathan’s niece NEVAEH, 8, whispers in his e

dialogues.speaker: NEVAEH
dialogues.text: Uncle Nathan, can you help me with my classical dance homework?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nevaeh is TWERKING happily to “OMG” by Arash as Nathan mi riding her like a cowboy. DANCING MONTAGE: Nathan holds Nevaeh’s hands and spins he around. He glances in the mirror and fixes his hair. Neva slips out of his other hand and crashes into the wall.

dialogues.speaker: NEVAEH
dialogues.text: Uncle Nathan!

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Sorry! They keep twirling. Nevaeh is red in the face but loving Ingrid watches him dance with a smile, then checks her ph She catches Nathan’s eye and makes a “let’s go” face. INT. AMAZON OFFICE AREA —- BROOKLYN - DAY Nora walks past rows of desks, puts her coat on her chair and touches her ear. A little earbud blinks on and she he Beyoncé’s “Crazy in Love.” She waves at her terminal and screen lights up. Across the room, Nora’s supervisor, LUCY, looks at a map the workstations. Next to “Nora Antony” is a headset icon Lucy pokes it with her finger.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: No music! The music stops.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: Cool! Thanks so much, Lucy! Merry Winterday! She turns to her screen covered with folders and opens on labelled “Rechna Futawarab.” Inside is an avatar of a MID AGED INDIAN WOMAN next to a million video files and an al “rendering complete: activate?” Nora hits a key and a win opens with a jiggling brain wave and an upload circle tha starts filling up.

dialogues.speaker: NORA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into her headset) Hello, Rechna. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’m not expecting you to answer me yet, the system is sorting through a lot of information right now, but I’m gonna count to three, try to count with me. One... two... three.

dialogues.speaker: RECHNA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (moaning) Oo-oh my God, where am I...?

dialogues.speaker: NORA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It’s all good, Rechna. Welcome to Heaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan and Ingrid finish making love, and she snuggles in him. Passing lights and advertising flicker on the ceilin REVEAL the bed is in Ingrid’s CAR.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Think they liked me?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Sure. You’re so fucking hot.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Sorry, what'd you say?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Your family. Your mom said I was the first girl you ever brought home for Thanksgiving.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: No big deal.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I think it is a big deal. I feel very special, babe.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: ++. Cool. HONK!! The car swerves, people outside curse, Nathan sits

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whoa, do you have “prioritize occupant” on?  10.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Of course. I care about us. You don't “prioritize pedestrian,” do you? He does. Ingrid notices something outside.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Park! INT./EXT. INGRID’S CAR POD - CONTINUOUS Ingrid’s car pulls over across from a little bodega calle “Whole Foods.” (For some reason, that chain has shrunk in the future.) Behind them, Nathan’s empty car pulls over t

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Sleep over tonight?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Uh...

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: (sexy) I‘1l make it worth your while in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Good. We need egg powder and a can of toast. EXT. INGRID’S CAR POD — CONTINUOUS Nathan enters the store. Her pod takes off, his waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan pushes a cart down the freezer aisle.

dialogues.speaker: FREEZER
dialogues.text: (Australian accent) You lack iron. Buy some spinach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A robot arm bags his groceries. Nathan pages through a tabloid on a screen.  11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Facebook/Panera Heaven Breaks First Weekend Attendance Records.” Videos show a Morongo-style hotel, with crowds gambling, learning to sexy dance, etc. INT. NATHAN’S CAR - SPEEDING - LATER PULL OUT to see the article is now on Nathan’s windshield

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Panera went online with a record- breaking fifty million unique souls and visitors. The aggressive former-chain restaurant is on an acquisition tear, its stock soaring after rolling up Monsanto and Facebook earlier this year. Nathan suddenly notices his car is going fast and is HEAD STRAIGHT FOR a double-parked truck.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Car, see the parked truck?

dialogues.speaker: CAR
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, it’s double parked.

dialogues.speaker: CAR
dialogues.text: Data shows no vehicles.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: I’m looking right at a truck!

dialogues.speaker: CAR
dialogues.text: Could you be impaired by drugs? Again?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Fuck you! Manual override!

dialogues.speaker: CAR
dialogues.text: Manuel? There is no Manuel here. You are probably impaired.

dialogues.speaker: STOP THE CAR
dialogues.text: Nathan CRASHES into the truck.  12. INT. NORA’S WORKSTATION - BROOKLYN - DAY Nora sucks an iced coffee from Dunkin Donuts, and works o new folder on her screen labelled “NATHAN BROWN.” She opens a video memory file to see... Nathan's POV: he happily dances with Nevaeh at Thanksgivi Nathan catches sight of himself in the mirror and grins. Nora pauses the image, then screenshots Nathan’s face and drags it to an empty wire frame animation, giving it a bl Nathan face. Lucy walks down the line of desks.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Anyone see my coffee order? Nora rotates her cup which says “Lucy” away as Lucy passe

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: Nope. She opens another memory file. Nathan's POV: the Pacific Coast Highway over the top of motorcycle handlebars, ocean on the left. Nathan looks in the side mirror and grins, the wind whipping his hair. Nora pauses the picture of Nathan checking his look in th mirror again. This guy just loves himself, doesn't he? Sh drags the image to the wire-frame avatar, which gets more detailed and high-res.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE CO-WORKER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ooh, young. A female co-worker looks over Nora’s shoulder. FEMALE CO-WORKER (CONT’D) And cute.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: He sure thinks he’s cute. Basic Beverly Hills douche. App start- up? Vintage motorcycle? Come on.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE CO-WORKER
dialogues.text: I didn’t say have his baby, I'd just dance that pole. I’m in the wrong neighborhood -- my Nitely fucks all have less muscles and body hair than me... How’d he die?  13.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: (looks at file) Car accident.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE CO-WORKER
dialogues.text: You mean motorcycle?

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: It says car.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE CO-WORKER
dialogues.text: Weird. I’m Uploading my fifth old woman in a row. Fun, huh?

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Nora carefully edits Nathan’s hair on the avatar she is building, which is very detailed now. Using a stylus, she smooths out a cowlick. Perfect. She is very good at what she does. She looks at his handsome face for a beat, then mischievously “undos” the last few strokes until the cowl is back, and saves her work. She clicks on another memory file, but it doesn’t open. “MEMORY FILE A56F432C8 DAMAGED.” Nora frowns. That usuall doesn't happen. She starts a folder labelled “???” and dr the damaged file into it. She opens the next memory file. Nathan’s POV: lights pass by on a ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaos. Nathan is on a gurney being pushed into an OR wher team is working on him. Ingrid follows, freaking out.

dialogues.speaker: ER NURSE
dialogues.text: Do you have any drug allergies, Nathan?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (voice is weird and whispery) No. I really think I’m okay.

dialogues.speaker: ER NURSE
dialogues.text: When’s your birthday?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: On the brif of Febinary.  14.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Oh, you’re not okay. God, I should have waited for you!

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: -.. Your teeth are so white.

dialogues.speaker: ER NURSE
dialogues.text: Morphine has kicked in.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: I’m going home. Nathan tries to stand up.

dialogues.speaker: BLOOD PRESSURE MACHINE
dialogues.text: (another Australian female voice) Sit down please.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER ER NURSE
dialogues.text: His vitals are dropping.

dialogues.speaker: ER NURSE
dialogues.text: 5 mgs epinephrine NOW.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Oh! We really want to Upload and I don’t want to miss the window.

dialogues.speaker: ER NURSE
dialogues.text: Is the paperwork all filled out?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: ER NURSE
dialogues.text: Heaven sales rep to the ER.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Wait, what?

dialogues.speaker: ER NURSE ANOTHER ER NURSE
dialogues.text: Just in case. Can't Upload a dead body.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dead body?! I’m going to be fine.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Baby there's pieces of you sticking out all over the place!

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN ANOTHER ER NURSE
dialogues.text: Could someone call my folks? Vitals still dropping.  15.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID ER NURSE
dialogues.text: They're on their way. Your Where is my surgical car called them after me. consult!? A man in a suit steps in holding a tablet.

dialogues.speaker: HEAVEN SALES REP
dialogues.text: Brand?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Amazon Lakeview please.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: I want to request Neutral Storage, it’s a separate form.

dialogues.speaker: HEAVEN SALES REP
dialogues.text: Sorry. One at a time please. I need to start with an Amazon ID.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Ingrid Kannerman. Capital P panorama ampersand 2002.

dialogues.speaker: ER NURSE
dialogues.text: Stand by on Upload Room 2.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Really don’t think we need Upload. I'm feeling pretty chill. INSERT SHOT: his vital signs dropping on the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER ER NURSE ER NURSE
dialogues.text: His vitals are still going Another 3 mgs epinephrine. down. I’ve got OR 3 on hold also. Where is my consult?!?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Baby, don’t try and tough this out. You could just old-fashioned die, or we could be together forever.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Forever? Um. Honey you know I love you, you're amazing, but--

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: But what? Ingrid starts CRYING.  16.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you’d rather die than be with me- - I just -- I --

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Don’t cry. Please don’t cry. Ingrid cries harder. Nathan is aware of the sales rep. Me too!

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There’s people... Now is so... (sigh) Of course I want to be with you,

dialogues.speaker: INGRID NATHAN
dialogues.text: there’s just a lot going on--

dialogues.speaker: HEAVEN SALES REP
dialogues.text: (thrusting tablet under Nathan’s hand) Great. Hit “accept.”

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Wait, what am I accepting?

dialogues.speaker: HEAVEN SALES REP
dialogues.text: Our terms of service.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Which are?

dialogues.speaker: HEAVEN SALES REP
dialogues.text: You want to read it? It’s like two hundred pages.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: I can’t sign without knowing what I'm signing.

dialogues.speaker: HEAVEN SALES REP
dialogues.text: Have you never gotten an app, ever? You can’t use the service without agreeing to the terms of service.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: But that’s not fair. If I don’t use the service, I could be dead. I mean really dead dead. (it hits him) Disappear forever dead.

dialogues.speaker: HEAVEN SALES REP
dialogues.text: I would choose “agree” then.  17.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Fuuuuuuuck. INT. NORA’S WORKSTATION - BROOKLYN - DAY Nora watches the memory unfold with interest, loudly suck her drink down to the ice.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (to ER nurse) What are my chances here?

dialogues.speaker: ER NURSE
dialogues.text: Your vitals keep dropping so unless your system rallies, you are currently dying of a punctured lung. I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: This is insane, I’m only 27! They stop pushing the gurney because the hall splits into directions: left to Operating Rooms 1-4 and right to Uplo Rooms 1-3.

dialogues.speaker: ER NURSE
dialogues.text: What do you want to do?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Sign the thing! Nathan motions to the Heaven Sales Rep to lean in.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: There’s still sex, right?

dialogues.speaker: HEAVEN SALES REP
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. The VR suits are amazing. You can adjust her avatar, you can boost levels, stimulation you wouldn’t believe. Nathan nods and looks around.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Where’s my mom? I need to talk to her.

dialogues.speaker: HEAVEN SALES REP
dialogues.text: Eww gross.  18.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Not about that. God. His monitor beeps another warning. Ingrid gets on her kne and holds his hand like a demented proposal.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Nathan please. Say yes. I’m begging you, we’re out of time.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Ugh. Okay. Okay! He touches “ACCEPT” and they wheel him to the right.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID NATHAN
dialogues.text: This is going to be so great! Okay. Whatever. (overwhelmed) It’s only for eternity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan is strapped in a chair under a giant device that h from the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: SCANNING TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: This won't hurt. As soon as the shutters are up to speed, the scanner will start recording. I’m jealous man, Lakeview’s plush. See you on the other side. He exits. (ANGLE ON THE MONITOR: Unnoticed, Nathan’s VITA SIGNS start to GO BACK UP.) Nathan looks above him where a metal blade is starting to spin faster and faster.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (scared) Uh... Can we hit pause here?

dialogues.speaker: SCANNING TECHNICIAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Please look forward at the spot in front of you. Nathan looks at a “LOOK HERE” sign on the wall next to th window where Ingrid and the nurses are watching him. Thro the window, he sees his mom burst in the back of the room

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Oh thank God. Mom--  19. Suddenly the Scan begins. A blinding WHITE LIGHT shines d on Nathan’s head, burning off one layer of molecules at a time, as a fan blows the ash of the already recorded laye out of the way. Quickly, Nathan’s HEAD FIZZLES down to his shoulders like burnt hair and the machine shuts off. His headless body, still with arm raised to his mom, fall into a cooler full of ice. As his mom and Ingrid SCREAM..

dialogues.speaker: SCANNING MACHINE
dialogues.text: (Australian accent) Upload complete.

dialogues.speaker: FADE TO BLACK
dialogues.text: After a time...

dialogues.speaker: NORA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hello, Nathan. I’m not expecting you to answer me yet, the system is sorting through a lot of information, but I’m going to count to three, and try to count with me. One... two... three... INT. NORA’S OFFICE - CONTINUOUS Nora looks at a wave form of Nathan’s consciousness. Next it is a circle that is slowly filling up. (Another window scrolls through the millions of video files and photos. I complicated and cool as shit.)

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: Welcome to Heaven, Nathan.

dialogues.speaker: NORA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You made it to Lakeview, you lucky duck.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (groans)

dialogues.speaker: NORA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hang in there, dude.  20. INT. NORA’S WORKSTATION —- CONTINUOUS Nora’s screen has Nathan’s brainwaves playing in a window

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: I want you to think of your self. The “I” in the sentence, “I think therefore I am.” Okay, cool, just gonna grab that... She highlights a section of his waveform with her cursor.

dialogues.speaker: NORA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’1l be your password, or passthought. I’11 always be able to use this to--

dialogues.speaker: NORA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: recognize you. Now, remember kindergarten? The alphabet song, A BCD? Think that for me... Yeah, good. Now think the color blue... white... red... yellow. Perfect. The darkness goes blue, then white, then red, then yellow then starts resolving slowly into a scene. INT. NORA’S WORKSTATION —- CONTINUOUS Nora looks at the screen.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (Australian female) I’m feeling pins and needles.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: (laughs ) Why do people always set it for Australian accent? Say again please. She adjusts some stuff on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (regular voice) Pins and needles.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: There we go. That’s a lot better voice for you.  21.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Yours is nice too. Nora rolls her eyes and ignores that.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: Pins and needles is just the program finding your nerve endings. Can you see anything? INT. AMAZON LAKEVIEW — CONTINUOUS The place is booting up -- a rectangle becomes a window. Details emerge: a wooden rocking chair, a crocheted cushi porcelain door knobs. Out the window, brilliant blue sky, dark green fir trees on a distant mountain.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’m in some kind of old-fashioned room... Nathan’s voice comes out of a simple male avatar with bro skin and hair, whose details are quickly getting filled i He looks out the window...

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: .--looking over a lake... Aaaannnd, he is completely detailed and HD.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ..-beautiful trees... And, whoa! A shark swimming right towards me!

dialogues.speaker: NORA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What?! That’s not supposed to--

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: (a little impressed) Ha! Sense of humor. Nice. Um, so, welcome to Amazon's Lakeview. The only digital afterlife environment modeled on the grand Victorian hotels of the United States and Canada.  22. Nathan looks around the room -- a big, luxurious, hotel s with a stuffed moose head and handmade wooden chairs with bark still on.

dialogues.speaker: NORA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hope it’s not too specific for you.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: It was never my thing, but it’s kinda cool.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: Yeah, our design team is brilliant. They took for inspiration the vacation spots of the Gilded Age millionaires, with a little Gatsby and Niagara Falls thrown in for fun. Timeless Americana, uplifting views, healthy pursuits. Good stuff.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Are there slaves?

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: What?! This is a design scheme, one, and that’s not even the right period, two. Lakeview is open to all races, religions, genders, absolutely anybody. I see you selected “non-denominational charismatic Christian” as your creed. That means, for you, the little chapel east of the hotel will be a Pentecostal Church. For someone else, the same building could be a mosque or even a bowling alley.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: I’1l take the bowling alley.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: I can make that change if you give me your Amazon ID.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: BrunoMelrosel18.  23.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: (typing) Your first dog and the street you grew up -- you used your porn name for an Amazon ID? Pretty poor security for a coder.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: Didn't work. Your charges are going to an Ingrid Kannerman.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Oh yeah.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: There’re lots of free activities. Swim in the lake, hike up to a gazebo, take a class. Nathan’s face suddenly screws up and he chokes back tears

dialogues.speaker: NORA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Uh oh. Dude, you okay?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (tearful) Yeah. I don’t know. No.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: Don’t be embarrassed. It must be really hard. To die, I mean. Especially when you’re young, and handss - um, healthy. And remember, they saved your body so who knows? Maybe one day they figure out how to put you back in. Nora watches with compassion as Nathan sucks it back up a composes himself.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Thanks. What’s your name?

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: Well, you’re supposed to just refer to me as your “Angel.”

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Oh. Are you dead too, or alive? Or just artificial intelligence?  24.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: I’m not allowed to say. Sorry. But anytime you need me I’1l be here for you. Just ask and I'll be right in your ear.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Okay... Angel. Nora, privately, realizes she likes having this handsome call her “angel.” Before the pause turns into a moment...

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: (back on script) So you’re all connected now. Do you look real to yourself? Ten fingers and toes? He wiggles them.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, pretty seamless.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: Explore, enjoy, meet your fellow Uploads. This is the first day of the rest of your afterlife.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Got it. OK. Sounds good. He gives a brave thumbs up. Nora touches her screen and i suddenly looking at 48 little windows with other clients them. She takes off her headset and rubs her temples. She finds she is still watching Nathan in his small window. She watches as he goes to the window, closes the shades a curls up in bed. Wait, is he crying? She touches the screen to make it go full screen again, a watches Nathan grieve.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: (gently) Hey, this was a big day. You died and were reborn, so a lot to process.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: Tomorrow’ll be better, you’ll see. Get some rest.  25.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Ugh, there’s no way I’m going to fall asl-- Nora drags down a setting bar on her screen and Nathan is instantly asleep. She watches him for a beat, then types something on her keyboard, and a blanket covers him. INT. NATHAN’S SUITE - LAKEVIEW - NEXT MORNING Nathan wakes up, sunshine streaming in his window. He stretches and looks around. Not terrible. INT. NATHAN’S BATHROOM He takes a long shower with great water pressure.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Oh yiss! Oh my god, yes!! INT. NATHAN’S BATHROOM - LATER Nathan combs his hair but can’t get rid of the cowlick. INT. NATHAN’S SUITE - KITCHENETTE - CONTINUOUS He walks into a kitchenette and opens the fridge. NATHAN’S POV The fridge is only stocked with drinks. A sign appears in air: “swipe left.” He swipes and the drinks slide away, revealing a fridge interior full of fruit. He swipes a couple more times until he sees a bunch of hot coffees. H tries to take out a coffee cup of steaming hot coffee. Another sign appears in the air: “IN-APP PURCHASE. Enter your Amazon ID and you will be charged $1.99.”

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Angel?

dialogues.speaker: MALE ANGEL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yes, Nathan? Nathan jumps. Behind him is a STUDLY MAN WITH ANGEL WINGS

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Yo, what the--? where did you--?  26.

dialogues.speaker: MALE ANGEL
dialogues.text: Ha ha ha. Don’t freak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Male Angel, a much shlubbier guy in real life, sits a his work station, with a Virtual Reality box on his face.

dialogues.speaker: MALE ANGEL
dialogues.text: It’s just VR so I can visit in person. You good? INT. NATHAN’S SUITE - CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: What happened to the one from last night?

dialogues.speaker: MALE ANGEL
dialogues.text: Not her shift yet. Want a coffee?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Maybe something stronger. Genie, a Moscow Mule please.

dialogues.speaker: MALE ANGEL
dialogues.text: Ha ha ha. But really, we have them on screen 27.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: .-. Nah. It’s okay.

dialogues.speaker: MALE ANGEL
dialogues.text: No problem. Later gater. He disappears. How weird. EXT. NATHAN’S BALCONY - MOMENTS LATER Nathan goes out on the balcony and sees a BEAUTIFUL LAKE pine-clad mountains across the water. A couple (ZACH and BARBARA) sit holding hands in Adironda chairs on the balcony next to his.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Hey newbie.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Hey.  27.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: Settling in okay?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. Are you both...?

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: Dead? Yup. But thank God we both had time for Upload.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: High school sweethearts. First woman I ever kissed.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Aww, soulmates. That’s awesome.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: That’s what it’s all about. Love beats death, two zip.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Cute. So, Upload, huh? (slaps his chest, deep breath) I feel completely real and alive. The programming depth is insane. And I’m a coder.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: Oh, what do you program?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (trying to remember) Uh... different things.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Good! Gonna go for a hike?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Maybe after breakfast. If I don’t want to use the minibar, is there a breakfast that’s included, or...?

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: Yes, in the dining hall, for another 20 minutes. It’s amazing. They’ve got maple bacon donuts.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: D’oh! Right? (off their stare) Simpsons? (mutters to himself) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s only been on the air for 57 years. INT. LAKEVIEW - HALL. 28. Nathan goes out his front door (Suite 10556) and is in a hall. He walks past other doors looking for the elevators INT. LAKEVIEW —- ELEVATOR He gets on an elevator with a woman who looks 18, but wea clothes from the 1960s, and is only in black-and-white. stares at her...

dialogues.speaker: 1960S WOMAN
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Sorry. This is my first day.

dialogues.speaker: 1960S WOMAN
dialogues.text: Oh! You’re wondering about my avatar. I turn a hundred next month, but I used a photo of me from 1961, although it might be my sister.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Is your last name Kannerman by any chance?

dialogues.speaker: 1960S WOMAN
dialogues.text: Yes it is. Mildred Kannerman.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: I’m going to your birthday party. I’m Ingrid’s boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: MILDRED
dialogues.text: Oh, honey, I hadn’t heard. I’m so sorry. Oh, poor Ingrid. This is really too bad. The elevator stops at her floor.

dialogues.speaker: MILDRED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s me. 10,300. (she stares at him) This is really too bad. She gets off, leaving him a bit thrown. He  29.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan walks past a CONCIERGE DESK with a line of people. GUY WITH A CHEERFUL GRIN (DAN) is offering them GUM.

dialogues.speaker: DAN THE ORBIT GUM GUY
dialogues.text: Gum? Orbit Gum? Piece of gum? Piece of Orbit Spearmint gum? Sugar free? Piece of Orbit’s new Wintergreen Wonderland flavor-fixed gum with healthy Sorbitol? People scowl and push him out of the way. A guy takes a piece and “0.75” floats over his head and evaporates. Nathan follows a sign for “Dining Hall.” He opens his fingers and his screen appears.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Ingrid. Facetime request connects. (Nathan talks as he walks thro the public areas of Lakeview.) Ingrid looks flushed and dressed up, a lot of people behind her.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Yes!! Hi there! How's it going?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (thrown) Uh, it’s okay. Where'd I get you?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: At a friend’s. So? Is it amazing? Do you feel like yourself? Was it scary? Do you love it?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, it’s really cool. I mean, I'd rather be alive, obviously. I met your grandma.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I know! She texted me. She said you were cute but a little lost.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Both true. (beat) I miss you.  30.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Yeah. I miss you too. Everybody's been all, I’m so sorry your boyfriend died. I miss your body.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Aww. I miss my hair. There’s something off about my hair now.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Yeah, looks different. Hair is probably hard to program.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Tell me about it. They look at each other awkwardly.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is this weird?

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: We'll get used to it.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Pretend I’m on a business trip.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: For the next 50 years until I can join you. 60 if I eat right.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Then don’t.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I had ice cream for breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: That’s so hot. Hey, so can I get your Amazon password? I can’t charge anything to my account here.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Yeah, we used my account in the ER.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: I guess I need your password then.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Well, I set something up where I get a text alert when you want to charge something. I like knowing what you’re up to. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Makes me feel closer to you. Hey! Show me the lake! Nathan points his screen towards the window across the po

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fucking gorgeous, babe! WOMAN (0.S. Ing! Ohmygod, I’m so sorry!

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: (turns to someone offscreen) Theng you! Ohmigod, I probably look like a fucking wreck right now, it’s been so difficult-- WOMAN (0.S. No you look strong like a goddess, like a hot survivor.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: Theng you! (whispering to Nathan) Baby, I ran into my pube stylist, I gotta drone.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: But you don’t have any pubes.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID
dialogues.text: I know, she’s amazing. I/’11 call you later. If you need anything I am here for you. Utterly. Love you.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Love you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora in a graduation gown between her smiling parents. INT. DAVE ANTONY’S HOUSE - CITY ISLAND - EVENING - CONTIN Nora looks at the photo wistfully. In the background, her Dad, DAVE, is in his kitchen.  32.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE ANTONY
dialogues.text: Hope you're hungry! I printed a steak design Jamie Oliver tweeted this morning. A 3D printer finishes two plates of dinner, layer by laye DAVE ANTONY (CONT’D) Oliver’s only on Google/Samsung so I know you didn’t have this for lunch. He brings the food to a table set for two.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: Speaking of work, Dad...

dialogues.speaker: DAVE ANTONY
dialogues.text: (cautious) O-kay.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: We've had a ton of upgrades lately. With my employee discount, it’d be smart to lock in such a good deal-- Dave stifles a coughing fit. Nora looks on, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: NORA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dad... After his coughs subside--

dialogues.speaker: DAVE ANTONY
dialogues.text: Sorry, honey. No go.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: I could be your angel, we could hang out--

dialogues.speaker: DAVE ANTONY
dialogues.text: I can’t. Mom is waiting for me.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: C'mon! You don’t believe that old stuff!

dialogues.speaker: DAVE ANTONY
dialogues.text: It doesn't make any sense, but it’s how I feel. How could Heaven not have your mother in it? He looks at her with a sad smile. Nora sighs and goes bac to her dinner.  33. DAVE ANTONY (CONT’D) How’s the steak?

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: I think your fat cartridge might be low.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE ANTONY
dialogues.text: Yeah, it’s terrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The grand dining hall with a view of the lake and mountai is full of Uploads. A sign says “Breakfast served 6 - 10a Nathan starts loading a plate with treats from the buffet

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Oh my god. This is amazing! Bacon and Canadian bacon. Chocolate chip pancakes. Noice!

dialogues.speaker: CULTURED VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Ten o'clock. Breakfast is over. All the food in the dining hall and on his plate disappea

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: What?! Aww! A disheveled angry guy (LUKE) rushes in and takes in the emptiness.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: FUCK! Fuckity fuck fuck fuck. He heads over to one of those industrial milk dispensers rubber tubes coming out the bottom, and opens and slams t door five times fast. A dinner roll appears in an empty bread basket. He scarfs the roll then does it again. Nath walks over.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Can I try? Luke nods and Nathan slams the door to get a free roll.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Useful glitch. I don’t know why I'm feeling hungry at all, I mean, there’s no need to eat, right?  34.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: The first Uploads didn’t shit or eat, didn’t even have eyelids. They all went psychotic in a week. Luke rapidly slams the milk door.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You gotta believe it’s real. When the weirdness gets in your head, guys are drawn to the torrent. He points out the window to the far end of the lake at a waterfall. Close up: THE DATA TORRENT. A rushing column of plasma wi steam boiling off it. Oddly beautiful and powerful, like Niagara Falls.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s the data stream between here and the real world. Poor bastards jump in to try to get back.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Can they?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Nah, they get blown to bits. My angel has me working on deep breathing and meditation to keep me “here and now,” stay connected. Of course, stuff like hot rolls magically appearing when you slam a milk door doesn’t help.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Tasty, though. They each munch a roll and grin.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey I’m Nathan. This is my first day.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Luke. How'd you buy it?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: My self-driving car crashed.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Ha! They’re supposed to be foolproof.  35.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Guess it wasn’t. How about you?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Lost my legs in Iran and spent five years in a wheelchair. Then one day I wheeled my ass under a scanner.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (sober ) Oh. Suiscan.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Yeah. But look what I’m working with now! He does a crazy little jig, gesturing to his legs.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Right on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan stands in front of a urinal, a stream of pee going Something looks “off” to him. Experimentally, he twists h pelvis. The pee stream bends in mid air and still ends up perfectly in the urinal.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Ha ha. Awesome. QUICK MONTAGE of Nathan peeing sideways, peeing behind himself, peeing out the window. In all cases, the stream curves and shoots directly into the urinal. INT. NORA’S APARTMENT - QUEENS, NY - BATHROOM Nora’s in the shower, under a horrible low-flo dribble. MANDI, Nora’s roommate, holds up a fitband that’s on a pi of Nora’s clothes.

dialogues.speaker: MANDI
dialogues.text: Can I check Nitely on your phone?

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: Be my guest. I am so done with that app. Well, almost done. Mandi snaps the fitband on her wrist and opens her thumb finger, making the screen appear. She swipes through Nite looking at profiles.  36.

dialogues.speaker: MANDI
dialogues.text: It’s proven to know you better than you know yourself, they invested a billion dollars in the algorithm. (seeing a cool profile) Ooh, they’re matching you with some real hotties. I get nothing but bus boys and meth addicts.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: I thought you said the algorithm was good.

dialogues.speaker: MANDI
dialogues.text: Yeah, I deserve a meth addict.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: Oh Mandi.

dialogues.speaker: MANDI
dialogues.text: Ah, he was fun, he was up for anything. And the lack of teeth proved to be pretty bomb actually. He gummed me until I screamed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan goes for a hike around the lake. It is really beautiful. He smiles at other scans as he walks.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Morning! Good day!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes upon a resort map on a signpost. Next to it, LOU CRUZ, fat, 40s, is talking into an Ansel Adams-style box camera on a tripod.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIE CRUZ
dialogues.text: Hey guys, its Lou Crayz, whassup? Coming at you live from Lakeview. So... I really like this view of the lake, it’s one of my faves. They’ve spent beaucoup bucks on getting the view absolutely right. It’s Lakey as hell. The waterfeel is more meh. Kind of grainy, and the sun on the ripples is a repeating gif but it repeats too fast to be really mwah! That’s all for now. Like, comment, subscribe!  37. Louie starts packing up his camera.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Hey I’ve seen the ads for a Lakeview V-cation, where is everybody? I thought this was a super popular place for Weekend Gigaways.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIE CRUZ
dialogues.text: They’re all here. You only see 5 floors at a time. Like what is your suite number?

dialogues.speaker: LOUIE CRUZ
dialogues.text: OK, you’re on the ten thousand five hundredth floor. Living people on V-cation are floors 1 to 5,000. You don’t want to go down there, it smells like a Senor Frog's. Everything over 5,000 is Heaven, permanent residents. He pinches the resort map and expands the picture of the hotel. It stretches 10,000 floors into the sky. LOUIE CRUZ (CONT’D) We all use the same map. There’s millions of people swimming in the pool right now. You can tell cause the frame rate drops. He points to a guy diving off the diving board. The guy enters the water in jerky increments.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Whoa. INT. NORA’S TINY APARTMENT - NIGHT CLOSE ON a Kindle-like device with a “Queens Public Libra bar code. REVEAL it’s connected to a VR headset that Nora wears, sitting up in bed. IN NORA’S VIRTUAL REALITY - HAWAII, 2004 - CONTINUOUS A scene from the Adam Sandler/Drew Barrymore romantic com 50 First Dates, only Drew Barrymore has been removed and is in the film, walking to her car with young Adam Sandle after eating breakfast. They are both being very flirty.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM SANDLER
dialogues.text: And the real cool thing about walruses is they’re very mysterious.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: Mysterious?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM SANDLER
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, we really don’t know what they’re like in the wild.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: They don’t just sleep on icebergs and yawn all the time?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM SANDLER
dialogues.text: Yeah that’s all we really see that they do outside of the water. There hasn’t been much research on what they do under the ice, which is where they spend two thirds of their lives.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: Well maybe they’re just down there intimidating the other sea creatures with their big winkies.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM SANDLER
dialogues.text: That is one theory. They both laugh. INT. NORA’S TINY APARTMENT —- CONTINUOUS Nora sits alone in her bed lost in VR. Reveal on the othe side of the room: Mandi is having LOUD SEX with some scra dude with bad teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan walks up to a magnificent tree next to a hedge. He pulls off a few leaves and looks at them. They are all copies of the same leaf.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (disappointed) Hmm. Cut and paste. Suddenly a tennis ball flies over the top.  39.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Ball! Nathan picks it up and looks over the hedge. NATHAN’S POV An 11-year-old boy, DYLAN MCNAB, sits in the middle of A VOID. The hedge was the border of what was programmed, an past it is... nothing.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Agh! Get down from there!

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Calm down. It’s okay. Nathan gingerly climbs over and slides to Dylan like a gu walking on thin ice. Dylan takes the ball and begins bouncing it against the back of the hedge and catching it Nathan looks down into the void, then back at Lakeview.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: This is fucking weird.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: It’s nice. Like being nowhere. Sometimes I can’t take it anymore, you know?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Are your parents here too?

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: No, I fell off a cliff at the Grand Canyon. My mom says I was a handful. (squints at Nathan's hair) Are you wearing a wig?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (self-consciously running fingers through hair) No. God, no. This isn’t my normal hair. They like programmed it really wavy or something. It’s driving me nuts.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, well--  40.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: At home I used a Natural Sculpting Creme and an anti-frizz Pomade, but here... (shrugs ) You're at their mercy, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Well, that’s--

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Pff. Wig! Kid, you’re hilarious!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora gets out of the elevator with her messenger bag. The schlubby male angel, IVAN, is getting on to leave.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: Hey. Nora nods hello. Ivan wedges his foot in the elevator doo IVAN (CONT’D) Hey, I got a friend who’s having a party in a sick loft Friday night. He’s got about a thousand Fentanyl. I've seen ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: Yeah, no that’s not for me.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: You should go out sometime. Get fucked up, have some fun.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: I go out plenty. Just not gonna be tripping with you in some loft. I’m not there yet.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: Too good for that huh? Don’t wait too long. This offer isn’t open forever. He lets the doors close.  41. INT. NATHAN’S BEDROOM - LAKEVIEW LATER Nathan picks up a remote and browses a screen that says “Entertainment.” He selects “Classic TV” then “Game of Thrones” and a sign appears: In-App Purchase, $4.99. He tries “Fargo”: In-App Purchase, $4.99. He selects “2 Brok Girls: FREE.” He turns it off. He opens his hand to call Ingrid but it goes straight to voicemail.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Hey it’s Ingrid, I’m either out or busy right now, but I’1l-- Nathan breaks it off. He starts pacing.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: I am so lucky. People save their whole lives for this. EXT. NATHAN’S BALCONY - MOMENTS LATER He stands on the balcony taking in the beautiful view and breathing heavily.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Nngg, nggg, calm down, buddy. A banner ad appears on a cloud: “You recently searched ‘Fargo: Season One.’ Purchase in HD for $49.99?”

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nngg, nngg. INT. NATHAN’S BATHROOM - LAKEVIEW - MOMENTS LATER He stares at himself in the mirror. He tries to fix the cowlick, but it bounces back.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: It’s all good. Gonna live forever. He smiles into the mirror. After a beat, he tries to rip cowlick out of his head with both hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora is in a stall, sitting on the toilet and looking at memes on her hand-screen.  42.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE CO-WORKER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Nora, are you in here? Nora says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE CO-WORKER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Um, your new boy is freaking out. The hot dude. He’s hiking up near the torrent.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: Shit. Thanks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora runs to her desk and grabs her VR mask. She glances her screen.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: Shit shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan walks towards the waterfall, passing signs “Data torrent ahead. Do not approach.” and “Avatars, AIs, Uploa go no further. The data torrent will deliminate you into undifferentiated data bits.” Nora appears behind him.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: Hey, Nathan, wait up! He recognizes her voice.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Oh, it’s your shift now? You know you work for a really fucked up thing. This is a bad idea. The ads make it look great, but it’s fucking... monstrous.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: So maybe not the best first day.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Day? There’s no day, there’s no night, there’s no dirt, there’s no rain, there’re no bad smells. I farted, which is already like, why? just a weird detail, and it was like someone spritzed the room with cologne.  43.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: It’s supposed to be Heaven.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: How is that Heaven?

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: Well, maybe not for you, but if you were stuck in an elevator with another guest...

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Uh huh. I just want to look over the edge there. Maybe I can see home.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: You realize if you jump into that thing, you don’t go anywhere, you just disappear. And there’s nothing left to rescan.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Maybe that’s just my tough luck, but it’s how it’s supposed to go down.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: Oo-oh. So you agree with Neil Beagley.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Who’s that?

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: He was a 16 year old boy who died of a uti ‘cause he refused medical treatment for religious reasons. Or the parents of Wesley Parker who let him die age 11 while they sang hymns instead of giving him insulin. You agree with them?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: No, that’s fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: But I did die.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: What was the first thing I asked you to think of?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: My a-b-c’s?

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: No, your self. I think therefore I am. That is still you, it has always been you, it will always be you as long as it can still be aware of itself. That’s consciousness and that’s what we’re in the business of keeping going. Why do you think it’s sometimes weird and unnatural here? Because your consciousness is thinking and comparing with your memories -- that’s you, baby. Doing what you you always did. Thinking and being alive. And I’m sure there are plenty of people, including me for one, that are glad you're still here.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: You don’t even know me.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: Not yet. But I’d like to. And I get this isn’t perfect, and maybe you were led to believe it would be since the marketing mentions Heaven like a dozen times, but it’s kind of better isn’t it? Maybe the imperfections make it more like Life, ‘cause Life isn’t perfect, but Life is the most magical gift there is. If there’s God, he’s amazing because he gave us Life, and the gratitude and creativity to keep it going as long as we possibly can.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (beat) You’re good.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: Yeah.  45.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (examines her) You're a living person. AI doesn’t talk like that, with passion and... pain. Soul. Something’s going on with you, in your life. This isn’t just about one of your clients. This is about you, saving people.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Is this what you look like for real? You’re not an old woman or a dude or something?

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: This is me. (suddenly self conscious) I mean, my avatar has make-up on and my hair is nice, and I’m not in sweatpants, so it’s a little better than normal, but nothing else is tweaked.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Good for you then. (matter of fact) You're really pretty. Nora takes this in.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But I’m not allowed to know your name.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: No. I could get in trouble. It’s a policy.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (disappointed) Okay. Nora makes a decision.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: My name is Nora. I live in Ozone Park, Queens. My apartment’s about as big as your bathroom, but I’m at work now which is in Dumbo, Brooklyn. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: NORA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s a really humid day and the bitch a couple desks down is taking forever to eat a tuna sandwich that I’m considering chucking out the window. Nora Antony.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: Likewise. Can we go home now?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Okay. They start to walk down the path back to the hotel. We se them from behind. After a beat...

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: What’s your favorite smell?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Fresh baked bread, right out of the oven? They walk for another couple steps, then Nora shakes her out and farts at him.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Eww, you weirdo.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: Smell it. He takes a deep breath, closes his eyes and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Mmmmmm. You genius.
